text:
While setting up a Tomcat Cluster, we want to be able to disable multicasting
and add only static members, similar to what was discussed on the users list:
http://www.mail-archive.com/users@tomcat.apache.org/msg36860.html

I have tried the workaround suggested - adding DisableMcastInterceptor to
disable multicasting and then adding static membership interceptors to add
static members. And it works as expected.

Can this behavior be exposed as a standard option (instead of the need to write
new classes like DisableMcastInterceptor)?
creator: shivahr@gmail.com
lmeyer@vmware.com
text:
You can disable multicasting with channelStartOptions="3" on the Cluster element:

<Cluster className="org.apache.catalina.ha.tcp.SimpleTcpCluster"
                 channelSendOptions="8" channelStartOptions="3">

Static membership is a little tricky though. See my example config on https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=52263 (it works w/ Tomcat 6, anyway)
